day_2: ^That's ok, I guess. Saving money is wise.
delivery_1: ^Well, that's one thing sorted today at least.
day_2_cont: ^I got full marks on one of my IOI re-training modules.
^What can we do you for you?
^And work on a few emails to my boss
^Things have been pretty shit lately. My boss is working me to death. Clients here and there.
^One of these clients wants some impossible things. They want their website to look all clean and minimalist.
^And then I show them, and they want it even more clean and minimalistic, I don’t know how much I can simplify it.
^I can’t reduce it anymore. They’ll just be left with a blank page at some point.
^Ha! There is no compromise with these people. The customer is always right. Nothing I do makes my boss happy.
^Not from what you described. And from what I heard you can find work elsewhere easily with your skills.
^Well, not so easily. Ugh my boss is ringing me. I have to go.
^Yeah she’s our second best customer. We can’t lose her.

b: ^Someone has to be fiscally responsible here

day_2_cont: ^I have to go and study now.

b: ^ I still don't have any comics sorry

day_2_cont: ^Someone fired a gun in Hyde park. Two people died, eleven injured.
^The whole area is on high alert. But it’s good for business.
^The business of getting clicks that is.
^Nothing much. My boss wants me to put out a bad comic.
^It has the Hyde park shooter reading the government’s new manifesto and then shooting himself in the mouth.
^I don’t even know what to say.
^He let me write a small piece about the manifesto, so there’s that.
^No one’s going to read it though.
^No one cares about politics anymore, unless there’s violence involved.
^Hey, violence is an integral part of politics.
^Who is this child? Do you know her?
^She’s messing about with you. Not a child.
^Call me that again and I’ll rip out your eyeballs.
^Your badge is hanging out of your pocket.
^I work as an illustrator and a writer for the newspaper.
^I guess employees like you are the reason why Calamity is so terrible.
^It's too boring, leaves out all the gruesome details.
^News isn’t meant to be gruesome. It’s meant to inform the public, and hopefully tell the truth.
^That’s boring. Who cares about the truth?
^Okay...if you can't see how messed up that is, there's no point in me arguing wiht you.
^I can see. I’m not the one wearing glasses.
^You know I can see through the glasses, right?
^You’re right. I don’t know why I’m even defending them.
^You know Blue Carp owns both Calamity and Apocalypse anyway.
^They have a monopoly on the news outlets so they win either way.
^Calamity is just your usual scaremongering, Apocalypse is a full blown shitstorm. You just pick the lesser of two devils.
^If you don’t like your job then just leave.
^I never said that I don’t like my job.
^I just have qualms about my employers.
^Maybe some of the things they do are distasteful to you. But they pay your bills, you should be grateful to them.
^Haha. They don’t just pay my bills you know, I have to do stuff for them first. It’s called work.
^Just don’t tell me to be grateful to warmongering fucking corporations.
^We’re almost at war because of them.
^Because of Blue we are in quarantine from the rest of civilisation, and nearing a full blown world conflict.
^Well, that doesn't matter. We’re all just pawns in this game.
^What do you need me to elaborate on?
^You said that your father would never allow that.
^I mean that Benedict Blue, the owner of Blue Carp is my father.
^And I refuse to let you spout nonsense about him.
^I think she might be telling the truth.
^I’m not sure what you think that name dropping is going to do.
^I’m a successful entrepreneur and you’re nobodies. I don’t care what you think.
^Why would you be so eager to come in here and start this conversation with Kent?
^Cas! I’m so sorry Miss Blue. I assure you, you are a highly esteemed customer. Would you like a complimentary cup of tea or coffee?
^Uh, can you not call her the r word. It’s rude.
^I’ll tell you why I started this conversation.
^I don’t really care about either of you.
^But I like this place, I love the funky old book smell, and it’s close to where I work. I want to see what kind of people come here.
^And to be honest, I’m not really very impressed.
^But I suppose I never would be.
^Uh, Miss Blue, your tea is ready.
^It’s just plain black tea. I want rose tea.
^Aren’t you robots meant to be mind readers or something?
^No. That kind of technology hasn’t been discovered yet. Honestly that sounds kind of disturbing to me.
^Her name is Pandora, you ungrateful brat.
^Ugh fine. Thank you for the tea. But I will make improvements to this next time.
^If you have any more magazines please order them. I’ll collect them the next time I visit.
^I’m a terrible shop assistant. Ada will be so angry with me.
^OK, but I don’t think it will help. Lavender’s just got a stick up her ass. Nothing’s going to fix that.
^I know, but she’s never been angry at me before.
^Sometimes when people are uncontrollably angry it spills out everywhere...like a leaky pipe.
^What Cas is saying is that people like that lash out at anyone, even if they didn’t do anything wrong. They think they’re entitled to hurt everyone.
^Haha, you know I think this is why I was such a bad therapy AI. But you two would make great therapy AIs.
^Thanks Pandora. Maybe you can recommend me to career services next time.
^I have to go, I have a lot of missed calls from my boyfriend. I think he’s worried after the shooting.
^You see Pan, lots of people like you. You’re a great shop assistant.
^OK let’s do the orders for today.
day_3_cont: ^Work lost a load of data and my boss has been freaking out.
^Yeah, I’ve got a friend coming later too.
^I’m glad I can help one of us out.
^What’s so bad about your job, on the whole?

^It’s not the worst, but I just feel like they want a lot from me. They have very high expectations. I’m not as good as they think I am. They think I’m holding back, that I’m being lazy. But I’m not, I’m just not that good. I can’t do what they want me to do.
^Sorry, Miss Blue, I'll be with you in a second.
^I came as soon as I could.
^Yes, my father says the police are investigating it.
^Yes, this is the place I come for my vintage fashion magazines.
^Those things are so cool, I love the old designs.
^I know, fashion these days is so ugly. I look back at those magazines to clear my mind.
^One for Tali too, she’s been through it.
^Do you think my boss will fire me?
^No, Dad will speak to him. It wasn’t your fault anyway.
^I didn’t store the password for the server so securely.
^My boss wanted me to take on extra responsibilities.
^The guy managing the server left, and well, they couldn’t hire anyone else.
^They were paying you for the extra responsibility right?
^If they weren’t paying you, they can’t hold you responsible.
^So how do you two know each other?
^Can’t you see we’re in the middle of something?
^Yeah I got in on a scholarship, I had a hard time fitting in.
^I remember once these boys were being rude to me.
^I didn’t know who Lavender was but she saw me getting bullied and she shouted at them.
^I can’t even remember what she said but they ran so fast.
^Lavender didn’t even look at me after that.
^But I made sure to be nice to her.
^She was super cold at first. But eventually she gave in.
^There isn’t a single doubt in my mind.
^That she won’t make it through this.
^You recommended this place to her, right?
^She really likes those fantasy books doesn’t she?
^Oh yes. I suppose it makes sense if you know her.
^She loves elves and dwarves and all sorts of nerdy stuff.
^I’ve only known her for three months, but I can vouch for that.
^Excuse me? I’m the least insecure person ever.
^Sounds like something someone very insecure would say.
^I’m just saying I don’t trust you. I’m fine with you selling books to her, but don’t delude yourself into thinking you’re anything more.
^Can I employ you here as a bodyguard?
^I take that as the highest compliment.
^By the way I did some research, all that stuff Lavender said checks out. Turns out she really is spawn of the devil.
^Anyway I better be nice to her, her father is my boss’s boss’s boss. He’s basically the chief of the arse lickers.
^My boyfriend talked some sense into me last night.
^I can be a bit reckless sometimes.
^I guess don’t have a lot of self preservation.
^I’m just sick of having to keep quiet and take it at work.
^And then I have to be polite to that little creep too.
^I know Pan. I wish it wasn’t like that though.
^You can wish as much as you like.
^The good thing is that nothing too bad happened today.
^The plague outbreak didn’t even kill too many people.
^Managed to get away with just a raunchy cartoon of an IOI nurse in a very revealing uniform sticking a needle in the health secretary's buttocks.
^I don’t know what kind of vaccinations my boss has been getting.
^I’m a little concerned to be honest.
^Sorry, I never asked about your day.
^Tali came around earlier, she was a little distraught.
^I heard something about that. It was for a government website. Lots of sensitive information was lost.
^I imagine she is just doing web design, it wouldn’t have anything to do with her.
^It wasn’t her data lost was it?
^You're worried because I'm a journalist and I might leak this information to get ahead in my career.
^, I have to make this clear to you now but I would never use information I gathered here for a story.
^I really don't care about my job that much. I mean sure I care about keeping it, but I'm not going to go out of my way to help the fuckers.
^But most importantly, I wouldn't do anything to betray your trust and our friendship.
^I appreciate you trying to protect the confidentiality of your clients' personal lives.
^I’ve got to go now. It was nice talking to you.
day_4_cont: ^I have a favour to ask you?
^That might help this business as well.
^I want to host a creative writing session on Saturday evening.
^And we can get to know our customers better.
^And it’s not like I have anything better to do.
^We have to give them to everyone who enters.
^You never know who else might arrive.
^My boss is trying to figure out how to appeal to the younger audience.
^He wants me to start drawing skeletons.
^He has an idea for this sketch with these two skeleton sisters who tell jokes.
^He thinks people will like that. Honestly I think he’s going senile.
^I think the idea is that they’re nuclear event survivors.
^Really resonates with our younger audience I’m sure.
^Also he wants me to give the skeletons large...breasts
^I’m trying to figure out how skeletons can even have breasts.
^I was just trying to understand the logic behind it, so I thought I would express my doubts to my boss.
^He said that: 'Both my wife, and my mistress have a pair so I think I know how they work better than a gay man'
^I had to weigh up whether it was worth losing my job over a response.
^Look Cas I really don’t know what to say. Why is Pandora looking at me like that?
^This is about something else I totally forgot. Pandora you can give Kent your leaflet, don’t be shy.
^It’s not a cult, it’s a creative writing session.
^Oh is that what we’re calling them now.
^I promise no cult activity will be tolerated.
^Sure I’d love to come, Saturday evening is fine. I love writing.
^She looks like she’s going to explode.
^I don’t know. I’d keep a safe distance if I were you.
^I can’t do my job and keep a safe distance from Pandora.
^I tell you it’s always better to assume the worst. You’ll never be disappointed.
^My boss is trying to cover for me now.
^They might move me to a different department now.
^At least I won’t have to manage the server anymore.
^At least they’re trying to protect you.
^If I stepped even a foot out of line my arse would be straight out the door.
^Faster than you can say disciplinary action.
^They wouldn’t even bother with Carol from HR.
^I do wonder sometimes what happened to her.
^Well I’m trying not to think about it.
^OK, there’s a new issue of Zebra man coming out tomorrow.
^He died in the last issue, but everyone’s sure it was a fake out. He’ll be back soon.
^I used to read it. I haven’t caught up yet.
^I used to have a crush on her. I never caught up with that either though.
^I don’t know what’s going on, but what’s so hot about a Giraffe Woman?
^You just need to read the comic.
^I think Zebra man has a better story though.
^I wouldn’t know. I find it so hard to keep up with comics. That’s why I hardly ever read them.
^I get it. So many issues. And they’re all so expensive.
^Yeah, I barely have time anymore to read everything. I have to be more selective.
^They have a small selection of books, but they always have something good. And I like the vibes too.
^It really feels like a dark old vintage bookstore.
^I can put on more lights if you like?
^Got it. You like hurting your eyes.
^These days everywhere I go all they have are these awful fluorescent lights. It’s disgusting.
^When I go back to my parent’s house they always have the lights so bright and they take the piss out of me when I hide in my room.
^I mean, my parents are OK, they’re just a bit mean sometimes.
^I don’t really speak to my parents.
^Just been having a hard time lately.
^Thinking that all my friends can just move back with their parents.
^Mine will never want to even know.
^And it seems Lavender cares about you too.
^What’s Lavender got to do with this?
^She hasn’t been bothering you, has she?
^Oh, she’s a real bother isn’t she?
^I would agree with that statement. Except you seem to be saying that sarcastically which means I think you don’t really mean it.
^Will it help me on my quest?
^My creative writing session. Saturday evening. Want to come?
^I wonder if Lavender will turn up today.
^Of course, she is our most loyal customer.
^I would like as many people at my session as possible.
^Not sure that counts when Lavender is around.
^So why are you talking about me behind my back?
^We were saying mean things about you.
^I just made you a Rose tea.
^If you cry the tears will go into the tea and make it salty. And then you won’t want to drink it and you’ll hate me.
^About the super special party you’re invited to.
^A creative writing party on Saturday evening.
^But wait a minute. What if I’m the only one there? What if this is a ploy to humiliate me further?
^Message her now. Or even tonight. Ask her.
^I just did. She said she’s going to Pandora’s dorky writing meetup.
^My first event. I organised myself. And three people are coming. Four, if you include yourself. Five, if you include me.
^I don’t use that word often you know. I save it for a special occasion. Such as this one.
^Let’s do the inventory. I’m so excited.
day_5_cont: ^Please don’t die. I need you to attend the party.
^OK, sure but what’s going to happen?
^I want it to be a surprise. I want even you to be surprised. In fact I want you to be surprised the most because you’re never surprised about anything.
^Even when Ada twisted her ankle falling down the basement stairs. I screamed, but you were like, well it was bound to happen one of these days.
^Oh come on, you’ve seen the way she’s always running up and down those stairs. It was bound to happen.
^I kind of miss her. Is that weird to say?
^Oh me too. Everyday. I wish she could see what I’m doing now. Do you think she would be proud?
^Definitely. I mean, she’d be disappointed it isn’t making money from it. But I think she’d be happy begrudgingly.
^It’s a shame the dome blocks phone transmission signals outside of London.
^I got an email. She arrived in Madrid safely.
^I wish we could call her though.
^I’m not sure she would want to be disturbed.
^Oh right of course. Sorry, I only ever think about myself.
^It’s OK to want things for yourself.
^I don’t know, what do you mean?

b: ^  I think you’re doing great. If we keep this up Ada will be happy when she comes back.
^ Uh I don't know, I'm sure Ada won't be upset.

day_5_cont: ^Really would love to chat, but I have something I need to do.
^Nothing really. I’m just really fucking behind on a lot of work. Please can I work in the corner there?
^Of course you can. Sit down. No one will disturb you.
^Well I don’t see why we shouldn’t let him stay here for a bit. He’s a good customer. And it might help business a bit if we looked busy.
^Maybe we should turn this into a coffee and bookshop. Might have better luck with that.
^Great minds do think alike. I’ve been nagging Ada about that for a while, but she hates it. She keeps saying she only wants to sell books. I’m starting to think she wants this place to fail.
^I have no desire to go anywhere near him.
^I was going to meet Tali here, but she cancelled at the last minute. Something to do with work.
^It didn’t use to be like this, you know we used to go out together all the time. Now she’s all busy.
^That’s what it’s like having a job I guess.
^I asked my father and he said I should leave her to get on with it.
^It’s just annoying, I have all this free time and she’s always slaving away. It makes no sense.
^I design clothes of course. I have my own fashion company and every three months I release new designs to my clothing store.
^Of course not, I have professionals to do that.
^Although I have been thinking of having a go again.
^I used to sew for fun. And then I did a lot of sewing for my university course. But I stopped doing it after I started my company.
^Uh, how does that work? If you don’t sew, how do you like prototype clothing designs?

^Well, I have people who also do that. I kind of just sketch things out, and my good colleague takes the sketch and turns it into a garment. I approve the design and she sends it out to the machinists.
^Except sometimes, when I can’t think of anything, she sketches out the design for me as well.
^I would like to start sewing again. It was so much fun.
^I just never feel like there’s a need to do it when someone else is doing it for me.
^Maybe I could order some books on sewing?
^This is cheering me up a bit.
^So you and Tali met at school?
^Most people were OK with her, but no one went out of their way to be nice. It made me so angry.
^She’s so kind and caring, how could no one like her?
^I remember they had a horrible nickname for me at school. Everyone would whisper it behind my back.
^It made me self conscious about introducing myself.

^Well anyway, I tried to be super nice to Tali, but it was difficult getting her to trust me. She thought I was like the others. She didn’t trust me. I kind of understand. It must have been strange. I mean really we have little in common, other than being awesome. So it must have been strange to her that I was talking to her.
^Honestly it was so hard, trying to find ways to make her comfortable.
^Anyway, we became best friends. We went on loads of school trips together and had loads of inside jokes. And I always took her on family holidays because I hate being alone.
^I mean I have four siblings but I’m not so close with them. Tali is like my sister.
^Nice? It’s not nice. It was very selfish of me. I think I made her uncomfortable.
^I can imagine being around rich people would be uncomfortable.
^You don’t get it because you’re rich.
^She likes my family, and they like her a lot. I think it’s difficult though. Her family doesn’t talk to her much. And she must feel so lonely.
^After she graduated she had trouble finding a job. My dad stepped in and managed to get her a role.
^She just needed a little help. She’s really clever.
^Then why are you accusing her of nepotism?
^She would have found a job in the end. I just saved her a bit of time. That’s all.
^So she’s got the job, what’s wrong?
^Well her boss is working her to death.
^That’s not good! She’s doing her best.
^If I were her I would shout at him. But Tali says you can’t shout at your boss.
^I don’t get it. I don’t get any of it. And don’t say it’s because I’m rich.
^Dad says the economy is failing because people aren’t working hard enough. But then I see Tali working so hard, and…
^It makes you think that’s a lie?
^No. It makes me think that if everyone worked as hard as Tali, our world would be a much better place.
^No, I was just expressing great distaste.
^I was reading at the back, sorry.
^Actually Pandora works very hard, for someone who doesn’t get a salary.
^Shhh, you need to stand up for yourself.
^You’re a lot more talkative than the androids I know.
^Really? You know other androids. I’m not your first.

^A lot of us working class folk don’t see many androids, at least not ones as sentient as Pandora. So when people meet her they are usually pretty in awe. They think Ada’s rich or something. When really Ada getting custody of her was just kind of a fluke.
^I think she got her from her brother in law who died. He was in the field of android development and they gifted him Pandora for his work.
^Actually I’d rather not talk about this.
^My father used to tell me stories. I was reading one of his favourite books. I try to read some of his favourites now and then. They make me feel like he’s still with me.
^<i>shoots Lavender an even more panicked look<i>
^My parents have an android maid who cleans up. She doesn’t really say very much. But she’s very good at picking up socks.
^I suppose I’m better for conversation then.
^May I ask, what were you developed for?
^Every android is developed with something in mind, right?
^I’m the youngest, so I suppose I was developed to be the creative rebellious outcast. Which I have succeeded in doing with flying colours.
^That explains the intelligence. Anything medical is on the highest level of intelligence.
^Thanks for that. Are you going to give me a pat on the back as well, a gold star perhaps.
^There’s no need to be that sarcastic.
^They should have programmed that out of you.
^What were they doing giving a therapist android to an employee. That seems far too important just to hand out.
^I think that’s enough questions for now.
^Remember to come to the creative writing session tomorrow. Bring Tali too.
^Of course, why wouldn’t I be OK?
^Well…no worries. I’m just glad you’re alright.
^Sometimes we must talk about difficult things.
^Hey girlies. You sure were chatting a lot with our resident little lolita serial killer.
^Like a fungus? Some people have no taste.
^I don’t really know what to make of her anymore.
^Goodnight, I have to go home before my boyfriend dies of loneliness. Or whatever disaster is going around the city today.
^I heard it’s the pollution. Beware of the pollution.
^What are you talking about? The pollution is EVERYWHERE.
^He didn’t share his comic with us.
^That sucks. Wait, he was working on a comic? Aw I would have liked to see that.
day_6_cont: ^So you know what day it is?
^Well yes, but it’s a special Saturday.
^OK, well, it’s my creative writing session. Did you forget?
^No, I was just messing with you.
^I like jokes. I really do. But not today.
^I mean there’s still some issues, but things are looking a lot tidier right now.
^Anyway, I want to forget about that.
^I trust you have all completed the assignment I gave you.
^Yeah, but I just kind of assumed it had information about the meeting time and place. I didn’t realise it had extra info on there.
^You would have realised if you’d read it.
^Seriously Cas, you work at a bookstore.
^Well I’m an employee here, the session isn’t really for me anyway.
^Me and Tali wrote our assignments in a cafe together today. We came prepared.
^No, actually, I changed my mind. I want you to do a backflip. What do you think?
^Please don’t make me do a backflip. I might snap my neck.
^This is a poem titled: Little Bo Peep
^I wouldn’t expect you to get it.
^It really went over my head. And so could you, if you did a sick backflip.
^If I do a backflip, I will make sure to land on you and we’ll die together.
^I always wanted to die in a bookshop.
^Stop squabbling. We need to talk about the poem.
^I think it was kind of funny. I liked the metaphor. I don’t appreciate being called a sheep though.
^No, I don’t think you’re a sheep. I just mean society in general.
^I don’t think you’re a sheep. I swear. It’s just about other people, who think they’re so clever making stupid comments about the way I dress. And they’re so boring and stupid.
^I think the message was pretty clear.
^It feels like it’s missing something though.
^I think it could be expanded a little bit, like maybe you could develop these ideas further.
^I don’t appreciate taking criticism from someone who’s brought nothing to share. But I do think that maybe you have a point.
^There was more I wanted to say. But I was too worried about cluttering the message.
^You should worry less, you know, just go with the flow.
^Tali, why don’t you share your poem next.
^This one is called: Origami Poppy. It’s also a poem.
^Lovely, I was wondering what that title meant. It’s about metamorphosis!
^It’s about the world using you up and throwing you away like a piece of rubbish.
^Yeah, and how your boss doesn’t care about you, and can just find another employee to treat like shit.
^But some of you are more right than others, if that makes sense.
^OK, so I didn’t specifically write a piece for today.
^I’m literally working on a Saturday. What are you doing?
^I’m actually going to share a fanfic I wrote recently.
^OK, introduce the piece to us. I’m not so familiar with this style of media.
^So you guys know I love Zebraman and Giraffewoman. And they are kind of an item, most of the time. It’s canon that they end up together and, well…I hate that.

^You see there’s another character I really like, Lionessa, and the comics make her out to be a villain, but she really isn’t. She's mischievous, but not evil. She’s a thief and a grifter, but really only steals from rich people. She’s helped Zebraman plenty of times, and she has the coolest outfits and she’s super hot…
^Lavender! No, this is about sharing. You should never shame anyone about what kind of things they like.
^I don’t like straight pairings but she’s different, every time she’s on the page she makes things…interesting.
^Anyway this is my short story: Prey and Predator.

^<i>Kent reads his fanfic, with pride on his face. He describes Zebraman, AKA, Zanthos Colt, lost and alone. He has just divorced the woman he thought was the love of his life, Giraffewoman, AKA, Giselle Heart. He tried to save civilians from a burning building the other day, but it was a disaster. The building collapsed and he almost got crushed. He severely injured his arm.

^The doctors say he needs to rest but he can’t accept the crushing failure. He almost wishes he got crushed by that building. Crime is on the up, the mafia still runs Savannahland and they are surrounded by suffering and chaos.

^Despite his injuries, he still turns up to the bank that is being robbed the next day (the criminals are on a tight schedule here) and he tells them to stop, he uses his super fast zebra sprint. But the huge mafia dude hits him in the arm. He screams in pain. He is no longer invincible. The civilians in the bank look at him with pity in their eyes. He can’t meet their gaze. He is a weak pathetic beta male.

^Suddenly there is a commotion. At least, more of a commotion than usual. Someone runs in a tight gold leather gimp–I mean a tight fitting superhero costume. She has the mask, as usual, little gold ears poking out of the top. It’s cute, I mean cute in a sexy way. Her gold eyes smoulder beneath her mask. She gets out her signature, gold whip. For a second, she looks at Zanthos, dead in the eyes. Then she winks. Her arms strike out faster than Zanthos can register, and the mafia dude’s head falls off his shoulders. There are screams everywhere. Somewhere from inside, Zanthos gets the courage to stand up. He’s not Zanthos, he’s Zebraman. And he’s here to fuck shit up.

^They make light work of the bank. But when it’s over, he turns around to where Lionessa was dismembering a man. She is gone. The police congratulate Zebraman again, but the victory is hollow. Where is she? Why did she just leave like that?

^Zebraman doesn’t have a lot of friends, he’s a solitary kind of guy. That’s the life he’s chosen. When Giraffewoman left him that was it. He imagined he would die on the job. That would be preferable to rotting alone.

^He takes off his blazer and jumps on the king sized bed. He can already feel the aches and pains that accompany him after a job. Then, in the corner of his eye he sees something. A glint of gold in his periphery. He looks at the window but there is nothing there. He sighs and goes out to the balcony. She joins him soon after, a flask of coffee in her hand.
^“Is that your way of saying thank you?”
^“And you think you can fix me?”
^“Fix you?” She laughs, it’s like smoke and honey. “No, I’m not so naive. But I want to help you.”
^“Friends? What makes you think we’re friends?”
^“You haven’t kicked me off this balcony yet.”
^He tries his gruff voice. It doesn’t work.
^She drops a duffle bag on the floor.
^“What’s in there?” He raises an eyebrow. “Did you steal money from the bank? Shame on you, preying on innocent people. Taking advantage of a situation like that.”
^“Banks aren’t innocent you fucking moron. And it’s not money.”
^Zanthos opens the bag, inside are…well. Handcuffs.
^“What’s the meaning of this? Did you steal these from the police?”
^“Yes Zan, I went to all that trouble to steal a pair of handcuffs from the police.”
^Zanthos rummaged a bit more through the bag, there were other things in the bag. Silicone things. Mostly.
^He looks up at Aura, she’s still holding the flask of coffee, but her other hand gently strokes the gilded whip that’s always strapped to her waist.

^In one move she strikes out, slamming him to the wall. Not as hard as he expected though. He doesn’t move, instead planning his counterattack. She doesn’t do anything else though…she just holds him there.
^“You hate everyone. You hate everything. You hate this city. You hate your ex-wife. You hate your parents. You hate…you hate me.”
^“Well, that last one is a given. I disagree with all the others though.”
^“You don’t save this city out of love, just duty. And you’ve grown to resent it now. You’re tired.”
^“What has this got to do with you?”
^“The hate is killing you. Why not just let go?”
^“I don’t know how to let go.”

^She stopped for a second, examining him carefully. She moves forward, her lips brushing his. The warmth is unexpected, but surprisingly welcome. He grabs her and pulls her towards him, but she pushes him away.
^She puts her hand on her chin. Then she grabs his shoulder. “Get on your knees.”
^“Do you want to know how to let go?”

^He gets down on his knees. The ground is cold and hard. He wishes he’d furnished the place a little bit, a little mat would have done wonders. Maybe a little one with birds and flowers. That’s what Giselle would have gone. But Giselle was gone, and all her little feminine trinkets were gone with her.
^“A thief. A criminal. A violent murderer.”
^“What? No, I never murdered anyone…who didn’t deserve it at least.” She wrinkles her nose. “What do you call me?”
^“Evil femme fatale lady who keeps ruining my life.”
^“Hmm, you’re not quite getting this. Quite slow. Never mind, I find a bit of punishment helps. You don’t mind if I slap you right?”
^“Slap me you sick bitch.” He wasn’t sure where the words were coming from. Somewhere deep in his soul, some dark hole where he’d buried his intense feelings of self hatred and loathing.
^The slap came and he found himself gasping. It was just a slap, not even a hard one. Why was he breathing so fast?
^She put one of her feet on the balcony chair. “It’s Mistress to you.” She smirked. “I bet Giselle never did that.”
^“Keep her name out of your mouth.”
^The slap came again out of nowhere. “Oh dear, you really don’t understand do you. It’s rude to talk back.”
^“What are you going to do to me, Mistress?”

^“I haven’t decided yet. I mean, sure I’ve been thinking about it for months. I get all these ideas, but I thought you were so boring. You wouldn’t follow through. No way, Zanthos would ever do that.”
^“Uh, better. Try to beg more. Use fuck less, it’s a bit impolite you know.”
^Polite? What did manners matter when they were doing…this kind of stuff?
^“Dear Aura, Please can you give me pleasure, in whatever way you find possible. I look forward to your response. Kind regards, Zanthos.”
^“Should I have put some kisses at the end?”
^“You’re really bad at this. But don’t worry, you’ll learn. They all do in the end.”
^I’m done reading, this is just the first chapter. If you want to read more, you can check it out on QwikFics.co.uk
^No, but I want to know what happens next.

day_7_cont: ^It’s kind of cool, not really my thing though.

^This is a freaking gold mine for news outlets.

^And it’s not just some rando getting attacked, it’s B.B. himself.
^If that’s the case, is it even safe for Lavender to be out and about?
^Eh, I’m not so sure myself, but she’s careful. And B.B has a lot of kids, she’s part of the last lot he had so not many people are keeping tabs on her.
^She wears a mask in public, bulletproof vest, and self defence weapons. She’s not some dolt.
^Maybe we should be scared of her.
^I think I’m looking forward to when we’ll all be together
^. I had a lot of fun at your last gathering.
^I’ll try to bring something nice wink
^Eh? Well as long as you’re happy I don’t care what you bring.
day_11: ^It’s been a day, don’t get clingy on me.
^I wouldn’t quite use those specific words, but I’m certainly glad you’re back.
^I assume you were covering the terrorist story?
^Yes, but please I don’t want to talk about it anymore.
^I hope my overtime cheque comes through soon, I doubt they’ll feel like much compensation.
^I’m just so relieved you’re not frequenting another bookstore.
^I’m a one kind of bookstore kind of guy.
^So glad you’re not a bookstore slut.
^I just want to be involved too
^So, you’re still up for our super Christmas eve party extravaganza. It's going down tomorrow evening.
^I remember. I promise I won’t stand you up.
^I’m going to bring loads of booze and snacks.
^I can’t drink or eat. But still, much appreciated.
^Sorry, I didn’t even think about that.
^I knew about the eating part. But can’t androids drink?
^We can consume certain drinks and ‘taste’ them the way humans do. They then get incinerated in our bodies.
^I could, but I don’t need to. There’s no desire, I don’t get drunk. I sort of taste the drink a little bit, but I don’t find it so entertaining.
^But does that mean we could like, toast with you?
^I suppose there is a social aspect to drinking.
^So you can drink without getting drunk?
^Well, I have no desire to compromise my hand eye coordination.
^That’s not the only thing that gets compromised.
^Ok, not really, but I’ll try my best.
^And try not to get up and dance on the counter..
^You better not be getting your muddy shoes on here.
^What do you do when you’re drunk
^You’re going to have to be more specific.

^Getting drunk does sound fun, but also unpredictable. I know that alcoholism is a very deadly disease, and I should discourage it. But also, alcohol is good for socialisation. I just feel like humanity should have found a better way to break the ice by now.
^I feel like humanity should have found a better way to do a lot of things by now.
^Yeah, it’s like drinking poison to get closer with your friends.
^Now that you mention it, it doesn’t sound like a very healthy way to exist.
^I don’t think existence is healthy by nature.
^Well, what’s been going on while I’ve been away?
^ have visited, they’re still on edge. And
^ is really paranoid about getting assassinated.
^That makes sense. It’s been a rough couple of days. I imagine the roughest couple of days of her life. Lucky cow!
^That sounds sympathetic, and also not very sympathetic.
^I don’t know how to feel anymore.
^I know her as a person, and I feel sorry for her.
^But also I’ve been working on this for so long my eyes have gone numb and I’m kind of a bit sick of the whole Blue family at the moment. They’ve had this coming for a long time.
^But surely he doesn’t deserve assassination? Just because he’s rich?

^Calling Benedict Blue rich, is like calling the universe big. Sure, it’s true, but it leaves out the true scale of the matter. He’s the richest man in the country and he’s using that wealth to isolate us from the rest of the world and start a war.
^Thousands of people die because of him everyday.
^I can no longer think of him as a person, because he isn’t a person. He’s a malevolent force. A great shadow cast over London.
^You didn’t hear about the strikes then?
^Exactly. A couple of years ago, there were strikes in a division of Blue-Carp industries. Everyone was fired.
^Later on a lot of the ex-employees were found dead. From drug overdoses.
^Lots of people turn to drugs when things like this happen, it’s not unheard of.
^A lot of them couldn’t get jobs anymore, they were tainted by their association with the strike.
^That’s bad. Why have I not heard about this?
^Why do you think you haven’t heard?
^There’s no way the government would allow that.
^Guys, why are you looking at me like that?
^Well, I get it, everything is shitty. What are you going to do about it?
^To be honest, I hoped you would have some ideas.
^So, do you think we should hate
^ because her father causes a lot of people to die?

^Obviously, she can’t control what her father does. But, she is connected to that family. I’m sure she gets a generous allowance from Mr Blue, there’s no way her job alone covers all her lavish expenses. She is a free, mentally capable adult and she hasn’t denounced her family. So, to some extent she is complicit.
^I don’t know. That sounds a bit harsh.
^You know what’s harsh? Dying of pneumonia because you’re homeless. Being shot by the police on your way to the shops. Getting blown up in an airstrike.
^I guess you probably want a personal statement to put in your stupid newspaper.
^I’m off work at the moment, Lav.
^I know how you journalists work. You say that, and then you’re going to go back to your stupid newspaper and publish everything I say.
^Honestly, I really don’t give a fuck about the Calamity.
^Well just know if you snitch. I’ll know who did it. And I have…contacts.
^You don’t have anything to worry about if you keep your mouth shut.
^What have you been getting up to anyway?
^Mostly spent time in my apartment. Working from home. I popped out to my favourite bakery one time but I had to run out because I thought I saw a red dot on the wall.
^Turns out it was just a toy laser pointer.
^Some stupid kids were playing with a cat.
^Ok, that isn’t even a newsworthy story.
^So, if it was newsworthy, would you write about it?
^Are you writing an article on my life too?
^What do you mean too? I’m not–
^I care deeply for all of my customers.
^We seem to be talking a bit more.
^I hate it. I prefered it when she was mad at me.
^Now she’s just pretending to be nice so she can avoid conflict.
^Maybe you could bring these feelings up with her.
^Don’t you see, that’s exactly what she wants.
^What exactly do you think you’re giving into?
^I don’t think we’re getting anywhere on this.
^There was actually something I wanted to ask you,
^No, I’m not that kind of journalist.
^I doubt even the people at the door got to see him.
^Why? Scared the phones are being monitored?
^Uh–yeah I think, any information could give away my location and then I would be in danger.
^You know he’s spoken to your brother and sister?
^Ok, ok. I guess there can’t be any harm in telling you. We know he spoke to Sapphire, and Sky.
^Well, it’s just that. My dad has favourites, and sometimes you’re his favourite and sometimes you’re not.
^And sometimes, he treats us younger kids like we don’t really exist.
^I mean, he’ll give us money, but he doesn’t really talk to us much. Treats us like we’re still kids.
^Ocean’s the exception, he’s the second oldest, but he’s never really been dad’s favourite. He became a pilot, and then kind of did his own thing after that. I respect that.
^Me and Finn though, we always get ignored.
^It’s worse for Finn…ever since he transitioned dad kind of just…looks right through him.
^Well, of course she loves Finn and I.
^And she loves Sapphire, Ocean and Sky as step kids.
^But when it comes to dad, she just turns a blind eye.
^She loves being his wife. His partner, she loves sharing his glory. Without him, she would be nothing.
^And she knows he can replace her just like that.
^This is about the time in the therapy session I would offer biscuits.
^I think I was a bit harsh about your relationship with
^Maybe you are the way you are with her because you’re scared.
^You don’t feel secure within your own family.
^So you try too hard to make her happy, so she feels like she owes you. So she feels like she has to stay with you.
^I deserve to be happy. Don’t I?
^I want things to be like they always were.
^Just trying to lighten things up around here.
^I need to take some time to figure things out.
^We definitely need to talk about what we’re doing tomorrow.
^I’m NOT daydreaming, you just need to be more specific.
^How specific? How many things are we doing together tomorrow?
^Soon, she will narrow her eyes and wrinkle her nose, and you’ll explode into a ball of fire.
^I didn’t know I was sharing the room with one of the X-Men, sorry.
^ said is true, I can also move things with my mind.
^ off the edge of a cliff.
^Now we are discussing the party I believe.
^Board games are boring, we’re playing drinking games!
^I can’t drink…or at least I can’t feel the effects of alcohol, remember.
^I suppose it doesn’t matter that much.
^ will like that, her family all sound like they could be cluedo characters.
^We’ll play cluedo, then you’ll get it.
^Also, you might be horribly bored to death.
^How do you deal with like, when your friends come over?
^Never been a board game fanatic, must be an only child thing.
^I’m an only child and I used to like them, well somewhat, before I got older at least.
^Well good for you. I just found them depressing.
^They feel like a crutch for people who just have friends around for no reason.
^Real friends talk and do actual stuff together.
^Sometimes, real friends also run out of things to talk about and just want to have an excuse to spend time around each other.
^Is there a screen where we could watch a film, maybe if
^There’s a computer in the basement, we could probably put something on there. The screen is fairly big.
^You can if you want, but you’re already bringing the games. I don’t want you to feel burdened or anything.
^Babe, I really do not give a fuck, it’s not a big deal. It’s just some games. As long as I get all my pieces back intact I’m happy.
^ means is that we really appreciate you doing all of this.
^I hope you’re ok getting here with all that stuff, it must be a lot to carry.
^I have muscles. I’m strong, like an X-Man baby.
^If you get a hernia, don’t come crying to us.
^ meant to say is that we are concerned for your health. And remember to always lift with your legs not your back.
^What are you talking about? I lift with my ARMS!!!
^Ok, I don’t think we’re getting anywhere with this.
^I don’t know. All I care about is that everything is going as planned.
^Maybe there’s something else you would like at the party?
^Something no one has thought of yet.
^Well, good music, drinks, fun activities…Oh wait a minute, music?
^Yes! We need music. How did I forget about this? I love music.
^You can play Cobalt Dragons if you like.
^Well, I will. But we also need music that the others will like too.
^So, I need to make a playlist.
^Thanks for offering! Makes up for you not having any board games I guess.
^Just getting my money’s worth out of you.
^I just feel like tomorrow is going to be amazing.
day_12: ^So do you have what I asked for?
^Trust you? I don’t even know who you are.
^You trust Ada, right? You know that she wanted you to do this, otherwise you wouldn’t be doing this right?
^I can’t exactly remember her asking me, but somehow I know this is what she wanted.
^Oh god you’re not taking it again, are you?
^Fate. It makes you forget things. Look, you have to stop it.
^I don’t know what’s going on with you, but Ada trusted you. I don’t know why, but it doesn’t matter now. You need to get your shit together.
^You need to figure it out yourself.
^I thought I heard you talking to someone–
^It was just some tourist asking for directions.
^Just quoting my fave Cobalt Dragons lyrics.
^Of course I know what you’re talking about. I’m ecstatic.
^Maybe when I was charging last night there was a loose connection. I don’t know.
^I am cheerful, I just don’t have the right energy to express it right now.
^I’m not…am I nervous? Is this what being nervous feels like?
^I imagine that it’s different for androids, but if you feel a lack of enthusiasm and like something could go wrong then that might be a clue.
^You’ve probably hyped this up too much in your head, and put too much pressure on yourself to make it perfect.
^I know what being nervous is! I was a therapist.
^I just…I could always logic myself out of this.
^It’s happening whether you like it or not.
^I need you to help me…just say something to make it go away.
^Ok, well think of it this way. If it goes terrible, at least you can always host another and learn from your mistakes. Make it better next time.
^If it’s terrible no one will come back. There might not be a next time.
^Okayy, so let’s say I’m one of your patients and I’m experiencing anxiety. What would you say to me?

^I would say that everyone always thinks of the worst thing that can happen. That’s why they get nervous. But, what if you imagine the best possible outcome? Imagine everything going perfectly, exactly the way you want. Just picture it.
^Wow, what you said really helped. Thanks!
^No, you know what, I’ll accept the thanks.
^I could never be sick of you.
^Which you will have to give back with the instruction manuals intact and ALL the pieces in the right place.
^We promise to take good care of your property.
^I see the way you handle that cash register.
^The way I handle the cash register is none of your business.
^I’m not in contact with them really.
^’s number in passing, we haven’t spoken much beyond a ‘hi’ here and there, and I shared an article I liked with her.
^It’s ok I didn’t ask for your whole life story.
^ I’m getting some major negative energy from you right now.
^Stop it. You’re not going to logic me out of my anxiety.
^It’s a coincidence, we just happened to arrive at the same time.
^Sure, I think someone has been following me.
^I’m not the one with the tracking apps…
^HEY! I told you that was for research purposes only.
^I’ll pick someone to go first. I’ll save you from the first round
^ as you don’t know what’s going on.
start_incident: ^I want to show you the new Blood Monster 3 that just came out.
^I have it on my Hoolflix account, if you show me the computer I can just login.
^You stay up here and enjoy the drinks and music.
^There was some kind of explosion it seems.
^It just looks so much like snow.
^You’ve never seen snow in your whole life, that’s why.
^It’s so hard to focus…everyone on the web is in a state of panic.
^My geiger counter is detecting normal levels of radiation.
^But we should probably head downstairs just in case.
^If we go down there and close the door, we can get the air filtered.
^Which we’re going to need, since that ash is probably not good for our lungs.
^What’s going on…are we going to die.
^Don’t be worried. I’m actually trained for this kind of situation, as a therapy android you see…well that probably isn’t going to help.
^You’re fine if anything happens. You’re a robot. We’ll suffocate to death.
^Here we are now. I’ll just seal the door.
^I just turned the air filtration devices on.
^Hey babe it’s me. Call me when you get this. Please, I love you.
^Oh, you might want to see this.
^SHOWS FEED OF HOUSES OF PARLIAMENT ON FIRE.
^You won’t be able to leave this building.
^And to be honest, you might not even want to. God knows what’s just happened outside.
^I need to find Scott and make sure he’s ok.
^We can’t let you do that, I’m afraid.
^I SAID I’M FUCKING LEAVING LET ME OUT OF HERE.
^It’s against the law, and even if it wasn’t, it’s not safe out there right now.
^Scott is on his shift. He’s out there.
^I’m sure he’s gone to find shelter.
^He’s a paramedic. He has all sorts of medical equipment. They take precautions when they go out.
^You don’t know him…he’ll do something brave and stupid.
^And you risking your life to find him is not going to help.
^It’s just going to make it worse.
^You have no idea where he is. He’s probably worrying about you right now. I’m sure it would ease his mind to know you’re somewhere safe.
^I can’t get a hold of my brothers.
^I tried contacting my family, had the same issue.
^There might be a temporary network issue.
^It might be that the government shut it down to counteract any terrorist communication.
^I will make up some beds for you to sleep in, we have some spare blankets and air mattresses.
^I’ll try and make it as comfy as possible. There’s a lot of space down here, and also a kitchen and a small bathroom.
^This was set up as an emergency shelter for events just like this.

^Convenient? No, it was very inconvenient. The amount of planning and preparation and all the things I always have to check down here. I have to make sure all the supplies are not out of date and do a monthly check of the facilities. And before I was around, Ada had to do all the checks. These kinds of things are not without maintenance.
^But why go to all the effort to do that?
^But Ada did all the planning and she’s not even here now.
^She’s safe in Madrid and we’re probably going to die here.
^Well, whatever the reason, I’m just grateful this is here.
^In scenarios like this it’s always good to look on the bright side. While being realistic of course. I think it’s just best to focus on what you can do, rather than future possibilities.
^I can hand out some toiletries. There’s a rather basic shower if anyone wants. I can play some soothing music before we go to bed.
^What if we all get killed in our sleep?

^I would alert you if something like that were to happen. My systems are on high alert, I’ll let you know when the network comes back up and if there’s any new news. The best thing you can do now is act like the explosion and destruction of your government’s premises didn’t even happen.
^You know what, I need a shower.
^I don’t usually like taking them in weird places.
^Is there anything I can do to help
^I know I’m just a shop clerk, and painfully undertrained for this kind of thing.
^ is not really adjusting to the situation really well.
^ has a towel when she gets out, I want her to be comfortable.
^I just need some time. All these alerts, well I can handle them but they’re making me a bit edgy.
^I can give you some space. I just hope you’re not thinking of doing anything stupid.

^You know over the past year, covering all these crazy stories I’ve sort of become desensitised to all this stuff. It was always something that happened to someone else, not me, just some poor soul or some idiot who did the wrong thing or was just at the wrong place at the wrong time.
^…but now it’s us, isn’t it? We’re the ones. At the wrong place at the wrong time. It’s our turn.
^I always wondered when it was my turn to be honest.
^I feel like…maybe if anyone deserves it, it would be me.
^Oh? Well don’t hide away too long.
^We might not get much time left.
^I’m not sure you want to know me.
^Oh god, I did not expect this from you.
^I thought you were better than this. Seriously? You’re acting like a sad tortured antihero. I mean, it works in comic books, but in real life it’s just…childish.
^What happened? Did you kick a puppy?
^I distracted you for a bit. I did my job.
^I can’t go to bed without it.
^Ok, let me just boil the kettle.
^Why is the kettle on that side of the table?
^The power supply is here, and it’s easier to boil the water here than in the kitchen.
^Then you can have fresh tea at the table.
^This place is dusty and smells of mould.
^What did I do wrong? I just wanted to have friends.
^I don’t think this had anything to do with you.
^It must be because of the stuff to do with my father.
^And then they knew I was here, having a nice time and they had to ruin it.
^I’m not meant to have a normal life with the common people. I have to be miserable and help my father with his empire.
^Honestly, I’m not sure what you’re talking about anymore. But, even if this is because of your father. I don’t think it had anything to do with you, or because you came here tonight.
^You’re right. I’m not that important. I’m just a nobody.
^Hmm…can you just repeat that so I can get it on record
^I…I know I’m not easy to be around.
^I know who I am. I know what I like. I know what I deserve.
^Yes. The silly games. The music. Tali looked happy. It was like she had friends.
^And it seems…she likes your brother too.
^Water pressure is not great. But at least it’s hot.
^They were folded by the shower in plastic sleeves. Seemed clean enough.
^Funny something about this place makes it feel like we’re in an aeroplane.
^There’s something stuffy and clinical about this place. Everything’s sterilised and sanitised but nothing feels quite clean.
^There are some spare day clothes…nothing fancy, some t-shirts, fleeces, joggers etc…very utilitarian military grade stuff.
^What are the sizes like? Anything I can squeeze over my shoulders or arse?
^Maybe there’s a nice bed sheet I could just drape around my shoulders like a toga. Ancient Rome style.
^If we all get wiped out maybe we’ll just revert back to ancient times.
^No news still. But we should all go to bed. It’s important to maintain a normal schedule for one’s sanity.
^I don’t see how that will help, there’s nothing we can do, why does our mental capacity matter?
^Did I just get told to go to bed by a robot?
^Uh, she’s right. Early night. Let’s go!
^I don’t have the energy to argue.
^I can’t believe we’re getting herded to bed.
^I’ll have trouble sleeping without my white noise machine and humidifier and weighted blanket and–
^And your beloved teddy bear Mr Snuggles?
^Yes, he sneaks into my bed when you’re asleep.
^Obviously, there’s something he finds lacking in your relationship.
^Please, for the love of god shut up.
day_13: ^I don’t know if you’ve taken a look around, but this isn’t exactly a five star hotel.
^The robot is making them for me.
^That’s because I’m not. I’m making pancakes.
^Exactly the right question, because I specifically asked for WAFFLES.
^The reason is because we don’t have a waffle maker.
^What about that thing beside the computer?
^Couldn’t you fashion it into a waffle maker, like the thrifty robots do in the films?
^Which you have obviously been watching too many of.
^And may I remind you, because I only just remembered myself, we’re in the middle of a national crisis.
^You didn’t ask. You demanded. And also,
^The kitchen is kind of small, and doesn’t have much fresh stuff. I had to use a pre-made batter mix. But it wasn’t so bad.
^I guess they’re like crepes…y’know I love french cuisine.
^Yummy these are so delicious…cough. What's that weird–unusual flavour?
^I suppose the pans have been down here for so long, they must have gathered a strange musty smell. Don’t worry though, it’s unlikely to make you sick. This place is very sterile.
^ maybe you would like to have a try?
^I wouldn’t want to deprive a guest of food. And anyway, not really a dessert for breakfast kind of girl.
^Is it not sweet enough for your tastes?
^I have some freeze dried ice cream I can crumble on top.
^I set an alarm on my holoscreen to alert me if the network came back online.
^It’s just for essential workers, government officials, and also media coverage.
^My boss sent me an email, and he wants me to go back to work.
^In the government’s eyes it’s kind of our duty to cover this, we need to pump out the propaganda ASAP.
^How is this even going to work?
^I don’t know, I need to speak to my boss first.
^? It’s Ada’s computer, and you know her best.
^Honestly, I’m not sure. I’m not even allowed to touch that computer. But seeing as this is mandated law, this might be the exception.
^How come he gets to do contact?
^Can I use your holoscreen to contact my family?
^We’re sort of communicating on a special private network right now, so in order to contact your family, they would also have to be on the network.
^I can’t let you use this, it’s government business now.
^Well, maybe we should wake her up?
^ in a crisis such as this it’s really important we maintain a normal schedule, not only for our mental wellbeing but also for safety reasons, we should all be alert.
^I wouldn’t wake her up for safety reasons.
^She’s not very happy when she gets woken up.
^Anyway, she had a rough night last night.
^Well…I was kicking her in her sleep. And she woke me up.
^There’s plenty of space in here, you could have slept away from her.
^…I don’t like sleeping on my own. Not in strange creepy places anyway.
^I sleep down here on my own all the time. I don’t find it strange or creepy at all.
^Oh I see. You’re trying to insult me. I don’t really understand it though.
^I guess you can’t sleep down here alone because you’re a pathetic baby.
^I’m going to feed you freeze dried banana ice cream for lunch.
^ you seem to be in some kind of delirium?
^I don’t know, I just find some of the stuff she says unsettling.
^She won’t remember when she wakes up, so I can’t even ask her.
^I think I get it. It’s a bit unsettling.
^How can you make light of such a terrible thing?
^We’re spending Christmas underground in this miserable room. No presents. No Christmas tree.
^We saw ash fall from the sky yesterday.
^We saw the houses of parliament BURNING on the holoscreen.
^But you think the manner of our celebrations is the depressing part?
^I could make some decorations if it would please everyone?
^Shall we make wreaths from toilet paper and used food packaging?
^Should someone tell him that it cannot hear him?
^They’re for all of us to share.
^Uh ok, well at least I can have the stockings.
^Those are for us to share too.
^ for setting this up. It’s wonderful!
^I set it up? Uh yes I suppose I did.
^It’s snowing. Is that real snow this time?
^ you don’t know what real snow looks like?
^The last time it snowed I was so young. I made snow angels and played with my neighbours' children. We made a big snowman but it melted…
^I had our housekeeper make me a snowman. I don’t like getting cold hands.
^We need to check our stockings first.
^I have some really funky tights in mine.
^I have socks, they have reindeer on them.
^Oh goodie. I got a new hairbow. It’s pink!
^You have so many pink hair bows.
^This one has hearts on it. It’s different.
^Slipper socks with those grips on both sides.
^And…what’s in that yellow bottle with the scribbly label on it? You get sweets? No fair, we didn’t get sweets.
^She’s hiding it from us. It must be really good.
^Whatever, I guess you filled them, makes sense you’d give yourself the really good stuff.
^! Don’t rip it open so quickly.
^I got a sketchbook and some new marker pens.
^I got a new laptop…thank god mine’s been acting up for so long.
^A dog bowl, some dog toys, a dog leash…do you have a dog?
^No way! I’ve got a dog too. His name is Cutie. He’s like a mix of a couple of different breeds. He loves going for walks and treats and watching the holoscreen with me and…
^ you got a dog leash too?
^That one doesn’t really look very safe though.
^It looks more like a noose than a dog leash.
^Uh that’s a strange gift. A joke I assume?
^I’ve never really felt like this before…it’s–
^Can robots really get sick though? I mean you haven’t eaten anything…you don’t even.
^It must be like a sympathetic reaction.
^Must be something wrong with her programming.
^I’m sure Adalina will fix it when she gets back, she’s so clever.
^The question is…why did she wrap herself such a strange gift.
^Uh yes. Thank god. I want to know what’s for lunch.
^It obviously won’t be as good as the Christmas lunch my housekeeper makes, but I’ll try to be polite and enjoy it.
^Do you remember that year Finn was vegan and…well…the nut roast.
^How could I forget? Haha we dared each other to try a bit and he was so pissed off because it was his special meal.

^I don’t know what happened there. I suppose that was Ada’s little project. I didn’t realise how far she’d gotten on it though.

^But, basically Ada, her husband and my late father were working on this virtual reality software which was meant to act as therapy. Creating a virtual world as therapy for people’s minds, to help them confront trauma in a safe environment.

^The government signed it off as safe, but it’s far from it. It’s a convenient synthetic drug that was made to ‘cure’ most mental illnesses. It moulds people into perfect little workers who always have the motivation to wake up in the morning and go into work, and do whatever is necessary to move forward in their lives. It’s a miracle drug.
^So then why don’t you take it.
^Because, as I said, it fucked up my life.
^It allows you to do whatever you have to do to move forward.
^I mean, they don’t sound like good things.

^I was created for one purpose. That purpose was not therapy exactly, but more specific. That purpose was a suicide watch.
^Dad–my patient had suffered a great loss. He lost his wife and child. He was in and out of these deep, dark depressive episodes.
^Ada, and his brother, had me made for him. I was an experiment between the two of them. She programmed me, and he constructed the robotics.
^So…you weren’t made by a big company?
^No, my existence may actually be…not so legal. With my level of sentience, the government should have full monitoring of my consciousness. But Ada wouldn’t allow that.

^Anyway, I was made for a man who was very mentally ill. And when I was given to him, he treated me like a daughter. He always seemed so cheerful. Happy to teach me anything I wanted to know. I started off my life happy and loved.
^I suppose, for a while, I thought I was his child. I acted like a dependent. I thought he was getting better anyway. I didn’t see the signs…he hid them from me.
^I was the one who found him hanging.

^I was built for a specific purpose, but then I shirked my duty. For what? I wanted to feel loved. In the end I let the one person who loved me die.
^Like you said, you were like his child. You didn’t have any experience.
^I suspect they programmed you with different expectations in mind.
^They didn’t realise your owner would treat you like his own child.
^And that produced a different outcome in your behaviour.
^You only became what he wanted you to become.
^They never say it, but I know they blame me.
^If there’s anyone they blame it’s themselves.

^Do you…understand why I did what I did? I didn’t want you to end up…

^After I’ve said what I’m about to say.

^Look, I need to explain some things about my life to you guys, I know that I’ve been pretty cryptic about myself. About why I work here and my life before. But I feel like if I get this off my chest it might help me heal.
^Sure, I’m happy to listen. We’re here for you.
^I know I’m your customer but I also like to think of myself as your friend.

^It started when I graduated from university.
^I finally found this company that hired me. They weren’t too large, but they were pretty ambitious and wanted to expand.
^My boss was very pushy, I used to work late nights and I was always answering his calls and emails outside of work hours.
^I went to my GP and they prescribed me this drug…fate.
^That’s had a lot of bad press in the news.
^I started taking it, and everything started going much better for me.
^All of a sudden my boss was much happier with my work.
^He started throwing these cool parties for clients, and I would entertain them. And then we’d get lots of business from them.

^Things sort of started going south when he wanted to compete with other companies. Some other companies started releasing this special car and my boss was furious. They were making loads of money and he wanted a piece of it. We didn’t have such good engineers. And others were making breakthroughs and patenting their own technology.
^So my boss asked me to steal their ideas.
^But I was so scared of losing my job at that point I would have done anything.
^And the fate made everything so easy.
^I kind of just saw my life as actions…one thing leading to the next.
^At first it was just a matter of hacking.
^But that wasn’t always a reliable method of doing things.
^A lot of the time I’d research people and find ways to scam them out of information.
^I used to go to networking events and get close to people, like a spy and find ways to find out information about their work life. Steal any documents if I could.

^It got to this point one day…this was the breaking point. I’d found out the apartment where one of the engineers lived. He was on holiday and I’d found a way to break into his apartment, hack into his laptop. Download some files, take pictures of some documents.

^No, it seems interesting...a king who forces 12 children to navigate a glass labryrinth every year for entertainment.
^A glass labryrinth doesn't sound like much of a challenge.
^Yeah, you could probably figure out the exit. See any dead ends.
^It sounds complicated and scary...but actually you can see right though it.
X_and_A: ^It's the names of these two heros.
^They were volunteer test subjects for this gene therapy drug.
^At first they went willingly, but then when the experiment started to go wrong, they weren't allowed to leave the facility.
^Sounds like they made a terrible error voluneering.
^Not much of an altruist are you?
^Only to find their identities erased from the earth.
^Their families were told they were dead.
^They couldn't just reveal what the scientists did to them?
^No. You see the gene therapy disfigured their faces.
^But there are also government programs to track them down and assassinate them.
^Luckily their powers sort of help them to evade detection.
^The whole comic is about them trying to reclaim their identities and seek justice against the researchers who ruined their lives.
^X and A are parts of their lab numbers, X was X-436 and A was A-967.
^Hence they go by X and A.
togue_acid_rain: ^So I have this magazine you might like?
^And they protect your eyes from the harmful acidity of the sulfurous rain vapours.

^It sure feels good to not get acid in your eyes.
mr_thermistor: ^Oh, this one is kind of funny.

the_ring_thorns: ^I've been wanting to get that for a while.
^In this world there are all these magical artefacts that were created by an ancient race of beings.
^This book is about this ring of thorns.
^It's this magical ring is one of the highest artefacts.
^It grants you immense power, but at a cost.
^The greater the power you ask for, the greater the pain.
^Why would anyone use it? That's horrible.
^What if the fate of your kingdom was at stake. The fate of all humanity.
togue_protective_gear: ^Oh wow, look at that hard hat.
^Maybe...if you hit your head in a very specific spot.
^Maybe people should try not to hit their heads in the first place.
^I suppose it's a bit late for me to tell you that.
bworld: ^Oh yeah, it's like set in a solarpunk utopia.
^They live in these houses made of plants.
^But then the plants start evolving and try to kill them.
^Well a plain utopia wouldn't be that interesting would it?
where_the_heart_lies: ^I found this book you might like.
^It's labelled fantasy, but it doesn't look much like it belongs to that genre.
^It's about this young writer who lives in this small village. She works for the local paper but her real passion is writing stories.
^Like no one wants to read them.
^Well this guy moves into the village.
^He had a job where he had to travel all over the world.
^But he's decided now to settle down in the village.
^And he becomes friends with the writer.
^He starts telling her stories from his travels around the world.
^All of these stories have a certain unbelievable element to them. Like they involve some kind of magical element.
^The writer doesn't know if he's making it up or not. But she can't stop listening. She has to hear what he says next.
^So ironically, he does a better job of telling a story than she does.
^I think writing and storytelling are two different things.
^To be a good writer you have to be a good storyteller.
^But verbal storytelling isn't the same as having to read a book.
^When someone tells a story you listen because you want to know what happens next.
^But when I read a piece of writing I don't necessarily read because I'm on the edge of my seat needing to know how it ends.
^A lot of the time I'm just enjoying being absorbed into the world, I'm entertained by the dynamics between the characters and their conversations.
^I feel like all that stuff is a waste of time. I just want to get down to the murder and who done it.
^Is that really the only satisfying thing.
^Sure if the butler killed the lord of the manor it's certainly dramatic.
^But if you get the feel of how the lord looks down on the butler, how he treats him with indignity. If you find out that the butler is having an affair with his wife.
^And then the reveal that he killed his master is so much more satisfying.
^I mean sure...that stuff is important I guess.
^Stories are more than just a sum of their parts.
togue_ppe_special: ^It's like fashion for medical protection equiment.
^I don't know. I'm completely lost now.
^What are you some kind of anti-masker now?
^I am grateful for the existance of masks.
^But that is not a good mask.
^He's going to walk into a wall and die.
^Do you want me to buy it or not?
queen_h: ^I think this one was on your list.
^That's cool, it's sort of a fantasy/sci-fi space opera.
^I don't understant too much about it.
^But it's about this queen who rules a lot of planets in the largest queendom in this universe.
^And she is sort of immortal. Almost like a goddess.
^But then this prophet tells her about this child who will overthrow her.
^And she want to kill this child.

cybershake_comic: ^I've got this comic to give you.
